aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Valuation Assessment by Morgan Stanley
Morgan Stanley's price target for Amazon is $195.
The $195 price target reflects 24x forward EV/EBITDA.
The 24x forward EV/EBITDA represents a modest premium to sector averages.
The premium is justified by Amazon's market leadership positions.
Morgan Stanley applies a discounted cash flow model for Amazon.
The discounted cash flow model assumes 12% revenue growth through 2027.
Revenue growth is expected to decline from current levels as Amazon matures.
Revenue growth is expected to decline as Amazon faces increased competition.
Morgan Stanley assumes AWS revenue growth will moderate to 15% by 2027.
Morgan Stanley assumes retail margins will stabilize at current levels.
Morgan Stanley assumes international operations will contribute 15% of total operating income by 2030.
Morgan Stanley applies a 12% discount rate to Amazon's valuation.
The 12% discount rate reflects execution risks.
The 12% discount rate reflects competitive pressures.
Upside scenarios for Amazon include successful autonomous logistics deployment.
Upside scenarios for Amazon include breakthrough AI services adoption.
Upside scenarios for Amazon include expansion into high-margin verticals.
Downside risks for Amazon include regulatory actions.
Downside risks for Amazon include competitive market share losses.
Downside risks for Amazon include economic recession reducing cloud demand.
Downside risks for Amazon include economic recession reducing e-commerce demand.

metadata.header_path: /Morgan Stanley Equity Research: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN)/Rating: HOLD | Price Target: $195 | Current Price: $185/
/Morgan Stanley Equity Research: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN)/Rating: HOLD | Price Target: $195 | Current Price: $185/

text:
### Valuation Assessment

Our $195 price target reflects 24x forward EV/EBITDA, a modest premium to sector averages justified by Amazon's market leadership positions. We apply a discounted cash flow model assuming 12% revenue growth through 2027, declining from current levels as the company matures and faces increased competition.

Key valuation assumptions include: AWS revenue growth moderating to 15% by 2027, retail margins stabilizing at current levels, and international operations contributing 15% of total operating income by 2030. We apply a 12% discount rate reflecting execution risks and competitive pressures.

Upside scenarios include successful autonomous logistics deployment, breakthrough AI services adoption, or expansion into high-margin verticals. Downside risks include regulatory actions, competitive market share losses, or economic recession reducing cloud and e-commerce demand.
